sections.heading: Purpose of the Home screen
body: Home is the main screen you see after a successful login.
It focuses on your daily work: tasks generated from your reminders, so you can quickly see what needs attention today or what is already overdue.
If there are no due tasks, the screen displays an informational tile explaining that nothing is currently scheduled and suggesting next steps, such as creating reminders.

sections.heading: Task list (tiles generated from reminders)
body: Each tile represents a single Task generated from a Reminder definition (for example: Watering, Misting, Fertilising, Repotting, or general Care).
Tasks appear automatically when they become due based on the recurrence rules defined in the Reminder.
Each tile typically shows the task type, plant name, location, and due status (such as Due today or Overdue).

sections.heading: Task tile menu (per-task actions)
body: Each task tile includes a context menu (three-dots menu) with actions related to that specific task.
Mark as complete: closes the task and allows you to optionally add a note, helping you build a detailed care history.
Edit reminder: opens the Reminder associated with the task so you can change its recurrence settings.
Go to plant: navigates directly to the Plant Details view for the related plant.
Show history: opens the task history showing previously completed tasks for the same plant or reminder.

sections.heading: Floating Action Button (FAB) shortcuts
body: The Home screen includes a Floating Action Button (FAB) that opens quick actions for working with tasks.
Show overdue: applies a shortcut filter that displays only overdue tasks.
Show due today: applies a shortcut filter that displays tasks due today.
Sort: changes the ordering of tasks in the list.
Filter: narrows down the list based on selected criteria.
History: navigates to the Task History screen, which is documented separately.

sections.heading: Sorting options
body: Sorting allows you to adjust the task list to match your preferred workflow.
Available sorting options include: Due date, Plant name, and Location.

sections.heading: Filtering options
body: Filters help you focus on a specific subset of tasks.
You can filter tasks by Plant name, Location, Task type, and Due date range.
Multiple filters can be combined, for example to show only Watering tasks for plants in a specific location.

sections.heading: Bulk completion (closing multiple tasks)
body: Bulk completion is available when using the quick shortcut views: Show overdue or Show due today.
When one of these shortcut filters is active, the Floating Action Button temporarily displays an additional action such as “Mark visible as complete”.
This action closes all currently visible tasks at once, without requiring manual selection of individual tasks.
Bulk completion is designed for situations where you perform the same care action for multiple plants in one session.
Depending on the flow you choose, you may still be able to add notes to completed tasks after the bulk action.

sections.heading: Navigation from Home
body: The Home screen provides fast navigation to other parts of the app through task actions and FAB shortcuts.
From an individual task you can jump directly to Plant Details or task history.
From the FAB you can open Task History or refine the task list using sorting and filtering.
